intro: Lappula karelinii, commonly known as Karelin's lappula, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the family Chenopodiaceae and is characterized by its succulent leaves and small, greenish flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or arid environments, adapting to harsh climatic conditions. Its seeds are often dispersed by wind, allowing it to colonize new areas. Lappula karelinii is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphological features and ecological adaptations.
